availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Now called Brooks, Kentucky. Located in Bullitt County at the juncture of Kentucky state road 120 and 1526 west of Interstate-65. Established as Brooks Station on June 26, 1858 between Louisville and Nashville on the main line of the Louisville and Nashville Railroad Company. Became My. Vitio in 1867. Became Brooks in 1885.

ab.bibl: Robert M. Rennick, Kentucky Place Names (Lexington: University of Kentucky Press, 1987), 37. “Brooks, KY, USA,” EarthExplorer, https://earthexplorer.usgs.gov/.
